required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect Of Medical Nutritional Therapy On Patients With Sarcopenic Obesity Requesting Peritone Dialysis Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Medical Nutrition Therapy on Anthropometric Measurements and Blood Parameters in Sarcopenic Obesity Patients Undergoing Peritoneal Dialysis Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, it was aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of medical nutrition therapy to be applied to patients with sarcopenic obesity receiving peritoneal dialysis treatment by measuring anthropometric measurements and blood parameters.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 3 months after diet programme
primary_outcome.description: Handgrip strength (kg) will be measured by using the CAMRY EH101 dynamometer. Hand grip strength <16 kg for women and <27 kg for men indicates low muscle strength.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the skeletal muscle mass
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 3 months after diet programme
primary_outcome.description: Skeletal muscle mass (kg) will be measured by using bioelectrical impedance analysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 3 months after diet programme
primary_outcome.description: 4-meter walking speed test will be performed. A walking speed of ≤0.8 m/sec is considered as an indicator of severe sarcopenia.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 3 months after diet programme
primary_outcome.description: Fat mass (kg) will be measured by using bioelectrical impedance analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of percentage of body fat
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 3 months after diet programme
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of body fat will be measured by using bioelectrical impedance analysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 3 months after diet programme
primary_outcome.description: The weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m2.

arm_group.description: The experimental group will be required to adhere to a diet consisting of a 10-15% reduction in carbohydrate and a 1.2-1.4 g/kg body weight/day intake of protein. The participants will receive 4 times face-to-face meetings (on the first day and on week 1,5 and 9). Each face-to-face interview will last approximately 30 minutes. During the interview researcher will help the participants to determine their nutritional behaviors, plan and implement the diet.

intervention.intervention_name: medical nutrition therapy in kidney diseases
intervention.description: Planning and implementation of diets containing high protein, low potassium, low phosphorus, personalized adjusted carbohydrates

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Volunteering to participate in research
- Be between the ages of 18-70
- To receive peritoneal dialysis treatment and to come to the hospital regularly once a month for treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any other disease that causes muscle wasting
- Patients using any supplement or enteral product in their diet
